page.title: 17ST MAWGAN / NEWQUAY AIRPORT
page.content: We interviewed Mr Johnson,the station manager. Newquay airport was opened in approximately 1955 and Brymon Airways terminal opened on the 22nd of May, 1965 by Alderman T.W Farrel.It is used for passenger flights to London, Scotland and the Isles of Scilly. The Airport has 30,000 passengers.The civil airport is next to the R.A.F. airfield on land owned by and rented from the council.The R.A.F. supply a radar,navigating equipment,air traffic ,firefighting and maintenance lighting .The runway is 9,000 feet long and it is about 300 feet wide it is the fourth longest in Britain.The Dash 7 a 50 seater aeroplane and the Otter a 20 seater fly from Newquay airport.The Brymon plane does 4 cycles a day it comes from Plymouth to Newquay and then to London.All repairs on Brymon planes are made at Plymouth by night.
